content:
Hello, there!
I installed Lean a couple of days ago to learn it, but I'm having some issues.
I've been reading the "Functional Programming in Lean" tutorials (https://leanprover.github.io/functional_programming_in_lean/getting-to-know/structures.html) which call the Natural number type as "Nat", but here it only recognizes when I use "nat".

Capturar.PNG

Also, when try to check the type of 1.2 it returns me that this number is a natural number, instead of float.

Capturar2.PNG
Capturar3.PNG

Finally, the "Functions and Definitions" tutorial introduces this "abbrev" to define a new name in Lean, but, like "Nat", it doesn't recognize this word when try to use it.

Can u guys help me? :)
Which version of Lean are you using? In Lean 4 it is Nat and lean 3 nat. So I guess the book is written for Lean 4, but your project is configured for lean 3.

To add some detail, Lean 4 is the latest version, which is still being developed, at this point there are sizeable communities of people using both, so depending on what you want to do you might prefer to switch to Lean 4 or not..

Thanks!
I thought I was using Lean 4, but it was, like you said, Lean4.
I've sent this message here talking about a server error that I got, but I could solve it.

Thank you, again! Your answer really helped me :)
